message.content:
cs.NI, cs.CR, cs.SY, cs.SE, cs.DC 

This paper focuses on the security challenges faced in securing the data plane of SDN, which is a critical component of network security. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses potential attack scenarios and vulnerabilities, which falls under the category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also highlights the need for centralized management and re-programmability of networks, which could be categorized under cs.SY (Systems and Control). Additionally, the paper discusses the architectural recomposition of SDN, which could be categorized under cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper discusses the overall perception that SDN capabilities will ultimately result in improved security, which could be categorized under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing).
